strings.Value: {g|Relations3_1}[Choice effects]{/g} "I support the trade agreement with Razmiran."
"Reject this proposal."
"I will fully rely on you in this matter."
"Tell me about this Razmir."
{n}Linzi broods upon the letter she's holding in her hands.{/n} "I received this today. An official letter from {g|Razmiran}Razmiran{/g}... with a trade proposal."

"It seems the {mf|barony|barony|kingdom|kingdom} has grown large enough to excite curiosity even in odd corners of the {g|River Kingdoms}River Kingdoms{/g}. It's just that..." {n}Linzi sighs.{/n} "I don't think {g|Razmiran}Razmiran{/g} would make the best ally. Since their self-proclaimed god, Razmir, rules there, tyranny has flourished across the country, and they think little of their neighbors. – They just occupy any lands they can!"
"If I were you, I would politely decline their trade agreement. Who knows – maybe it's a trick? Although the terms seem profitable..." {n}Linzi looks at the letter again.{/n}
{n}Valerie shows you an open letter bearing an official seal.{/n} "We have received an offer of a trade agreement from the kingdom of {g|Razmiran}Razmiran{/g}, which lies to the west of your lands."
"The proposal seems quite fair. The letter was composed by Razmir's lawyers, and it seems very transparent. Of course, I will give it to our men of law, if you deem it worthy of consideration."

{n}Valerie pauses.{/n} "Of course you know that {g|Razmiran}Razmiran{/g} is an unusual kingdom. Many are suspicious of its self-proclaimed god ruler, and its aggressive ambitions... But I won't give you any advice on this matter. Please make your own decision."

{n}Bartholomew holds up an open letter.{/n} "Look, {mf|Your Grace|Your Grace|Your Highness|Your Highness}! Your neighbors seek trade agreements with you. I received this letter from distant {g|Razmiran}Razmiran{/g} – a country ruled by Razmir himself. Have you heard of him?"

"He's quite a curious person, I must say! Managed to persuade the entire country that he's a living god! That's something to admire!" {n}Bartholomew laughs.{/n} "Well, whatever you may think of that, his country is among the most promising of the young kingdoms. We could use such a friendship!"
"I think we should accept this agreement. But of course, the final decision is yours!"
{n}Linzi sighs.{/n} "As you wish. I'm just afraid this might not turn out well for us..."
{n}Valerie nods.{/n} "Understood."
{n}Bartholomew tenderly strokes the letter in his hands.{/n} "An excellent decision, {mf|Your Grace|Your Grace|Your Highness|Your Highness}! I will compose our reply immediately!"
{n}Linzi catches her breath.{/n} "Ah... truth be told, I'm glad. I wouldn't feel good about dealing with a rascal like Razmir..."
{n}Bartholomew closes his eyes wearily.{/n} "As you wish..."
"Really? Then I will reject the agreement. Let's just say we both listened to my intuition – it never lets me down!"
"In that case, {mf|Your Grace|Your Grace|Your Highness|Your Highness}, I am inclined to accept. I shall compose our reply without delay!"

"He's a quirky fellow. He took over a kingdom, and persuaded all the locals that he's a living god! He installed his henchmen in all the key positions, and now rules as he pleases, oppressing the population!"

{n}Linzi sighs.{/n} "The more I think about it, the less I like the idea of dealing with him. He has repeatedly expanded the territory of his own kingdom by occupying his neighbors! Such an attitude towards other countries is seriously worrying."

"If you asked one of {g|Razmiran}Razmiran{/g}'s citizens, you'd hear praises to great god, protector of his nation." {n}Valerie purses her lips.{/n} "But Razmir is no god. Most likely, he's a mighty wizard. He doesn't possess even a trace of true divinity."

"But {g|Razmiran}Razmiran{/g} is far more than a handful of fanatics. It's a fully independent state. Under Razmir, it has only thrived, and can stand against its enemies. Razmir set his own laws – and it's not up to me to judge them. It's better there are laws than not."

"I don't know who he is and where he came from. What's important is that he's capable of subduing an entire nation! Presenting himself as a new god – what an unconventional step! He even provides divine spells to his priests! I don't know how, but he found a way!"

{n}Bartholomew lifts a finger.{/n} "Think well on this trade agreement with {g|Razmiran}Razmiran{/g}, {mf|Your Grace|Your Grace|Your Highness|Your Highness}. Who knows what opportunities may open to us if we sign it!"
